page.title: 16Politics in Great Coxwell
page.content: There have been Parish Council,County Council,General & European elections. The Parish Reading Room is used as the Polling Station.It is also used for monthly Parish Council meetings and, on alternate years, for the annual general meeting of the local Conserv- ative Association.At election times, one resident allows the Conservative Association to use his front room as a Committee Room,so that each person who votes can be marked off on the elect- oral roll.Towards the end of the day members of the Association can then remind anyone who has so far failed to vote,to do so if they wish.During the weeks before an election,candidates send leaflets to each house,and some visit in person.
